name: 2-aminopropane
source: Dreisbach R. R. Physical Properties of Chemical Compounds; Vol. III; American Chemical Society; Washington; 1961.
Reason: 2-Aminopropane has a melting point of -100.0 degrees Celsius. The basic unit of analysis is propane, which has a melting point of -18.0 degrees Celsius. The amino group introduces a hydrogen bonding potential, which can increase the melting point by approximately +10 degrees Celsius.
